knownedge_bases.name: knowledge_about_astronomy
knownedge_bases.description: Facts about celestial bodies, space phenomena, and the universe
items: The sky appears blue because Earth's atmosphere scatters shorter blue wavelengths of sunlight more than longer red wavelengths
A day on Venus is longer than its year - Venus takes 243 Earth days to rotate once but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun
Neutron stars are so dense that a teaspoon of neutron star material would weigh about 6 billion tons on Earth
The Milky Way galaxy is on a collision course with the Andromeda galaxy, expected to merge in about 4.5 billion years
Black holes don't actually suck things in - objects must cross the event horizon to be trapped by the immense gravitational field

knownedge_bases.name: knowledge_about_biology
knownedge_bases.description: Facts about living organisms, evolution, and life processes
items: Octopuses have three hearts - two pump blood to the gills while the third pumps blood to the rest of the body
Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas because all life forms evolved from common ancestral organisms
Tardigrades can survive in outer space because they can enter cryptobiosis, a state where their metabolism nearly stops
Trees communicate through underground fungal networks called mycorrhizae, sharing nutrients and warning signals
The human brain uses about 20% of the body's total energy despite being only 2% of body weight

knownedge_bases.name: knowledge_about_history
knownedge_bases.description: Significant events, civilizations, and developments throughout human history
items: The Library of Alexandria declined gradually over centuries because of reduced funding, political instability, and changing educational priorities, not a single fire
The Great Wall of China is not visible from space with the naked eye because it's too narrow and blends with the surrounding landscape
Vikings reached North America 500 years before Columbus because archaeological evidence at L'Anse aux Meadows confirms Norse settlement around 1000 CE
The Renaissance began in Italy because wealthy merchant families like the Medici patronized arts and learning, and Italian city-states had contact with Byzantine scholars
The printing press revolutionized society because it made books affordable and widely available, spreading literacy and ideas rapidly
